item.title: Report E-2024050656
item.description:
Report E-2024050656

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 23, 2024, two (2) 1-gallon bottles of UN1789 were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized absorbent pads to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The two (2) damaged containers of product were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024051463
item.description:
Report X-2024051463

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=729268110379 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Solid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Loading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1263 CLASS=30 QTY UOM=Liquid - Liter PSN TEXT=paint PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=10 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=7.6 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )On 5/22/2024 at approximately 2045, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5219632 at the ramp facility in Atlanta, reporting a dry ice spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing a polystyrene insert that held a paint shipment packed on dry ice. The outer appeared to lose intergrity fell apart, resulting in the spillage of dry ice. The paint shipment remained unharried. The shipment awaits pick-up by the shipper.
